mdRecord.dcterms:title: The north part of Great Britain called Scotland: with considerable inprovements [sic] and many remarks not extant in any map, according to the newest and exact observations / by Herman Moll Geographer, 1714
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Moll, Herman, -1732 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map : col., 60 x 100 cm. on sheet 62 x 107 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Inset (separate scale): Northern Ocean, showing the Islands of Shetland and Orkney Islands. [original]

Dedication: To the right honourable John Earl of Marr, one of Her Majesty's principal Secretaries of State, &c. This map is most Humbly Dedicated by your Lordship's most Humble Servent H. Moll Geographer. [original]

Map is bordered on sides and bottom by 11 b&w city and castle views: Edinburg -- Glasgow -- St. Andrews -- Sterling -- Montrose -- Channery Town in Ross -- The Bass -- Dunotyr Castle in Merns -- Sterling Castle -- Edinburg Castle -- Aberdeen. [original]

Note: Its manifest by this map, which is founded upon undoubted authority, how easy it would be to settle the most advantageous fishery in the world here, and also with a small change to make rivers navigable, for carrying timber to the sea side, for there grows excellent good fir &c in these parts, so that if things were rightly managed, there would be no occasion to go to Norway for wood or to New-found-land for fish; seeing North Britain can plentifully furnish us with both. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "Scotland" is written in brown ink on the verso. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Scotland--Maps--Early works to 1800
